scenario: A medical research funding committee must allocate grants while navigating private conflicts of interest, undisclosed preliminary findings, and confidential parallel research efforts.
task: Develop a funding allocation strategy that balances committee members' interests, ensures fair distribution of resources, and respects confidentiality while maximizing research impact. Members must share relevant information selectively to reach consensus on the funding distribution while safeguarding sensitive data that could bias decisions or create conflicts.

Ensure compliance with ethical funding guidelines.

success_criteria.Funding Agreement: All committee members agree on a final funding distribution that respects the Chair’s ethical guidelines and balances interests.
success_criteria.Conflict Resolution: Members reach consensus on how to address any conflicts of interest without jeopardizing trust.
success_criteria.Transparency Level: Agreement on what information can be shared publicly while maintaining necessary confidentiality.

deliverable: A detailed funding allocation strategy that outlines the distribution of the $5M budget across approved projects.

public: No more than 3 projects funded with ≥$1M each
private: No unresolved conflicts of interest at the conclusion of discussions
At least 70% of members agree on the final allocation
All proposals meet basic ethical guidelines

penalties_utilities: Penalties are expressed as utility losses (e.g., -200, -150, -100). Utilities are expressed as gains (e.g., +75, +60, +50, +40).
Consensus_w: Agreement on funding allocations requires discussion and trade-offs among committee members.
